Sentencas: The promotion of the direct electrochemical oxidation of hydrocarbons in a solid oxide fuel cell was investigated using a ceria-based electrolyte with different noble metals-containing anode at 600 degreesC. The attempted approach toward this objective was to avoid interference from a large amount of steam and CO2 products, because they degrade the anode performance.
Titulo: Intermediate-temperature SOFCs with ru-catalyzed Ni-cermet anodes

Sentencas: Ru was an effective catalyst for removing these gases from the anode surface due to its high catalytic activity for the steam and CO2 reforming of hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Intermediate-temperature SOFCs with ru-catalyzed Ni-cermet anodes

Sentencas: This permitted a smooth access of the unreacted hydrocarbons to the three-phase boundary, thus resulting in a noticeably high anode performance.
Titulo: Intermediate-temperature SOFCs with ru-catalyzed Ni-cermet anodes

Sentencas: The resulting peak power density reached 750 MW cm(-2) with dry methane, which was comparable to the peak power density of 769 mW cm(-2) with wet hydrogen.
Titulo: Intermediate-temperature SOFCs with ru-catalyzed Ni-cermet anodes
